ygData.subject: RE: A reply to Brian
ygData.msgSnippet: You kind of missed my point(s).  What I was asking is why do you think Human SK in particular need to be tweeked? 1) Human SK s in solo combat.  A human SK
ygData.messageBody:
You kind of missed my point(s). What I was asking is why do you think Human SK in particular need to be tweeked?

1) Human SK's in solo combat. A human SK should be better in one on one combat than an equivalent level Paladin (LoH and HT aside). So why do SK's in particular need to be improved?

2) Humans are generally inferior to their non-human counterparts on a per-encounter basis. This is true for all classes and is balanced out by the Human exp bonus and other racial exp penalties.

3) KoS makes the game harder for SK's. This is a game difficulty issue IMHO. That's why you have the difficulty ratings at character creation because all race/class combos are not as easy as anothers. My KoS problem as a TSK is far worse than any Human SK. I don't see you saying that Troll SK's need improvement.

I'm just trying to understand where the Human SK's are coming from. I personally think you have it easier than us TSK's, so why should Human SK's be improved and not Trolls, Ogres, & DE's as well. Sure, I can solo better than you can up until around level 20, but after that it's pretty much out as a viable leveling option.

Scragg Wraithbone of Bristlebane


>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

Scragg,

A human SK will have a tougher time than a human paladin if for no other reason than they're KOS in a lot more places. Being evil
really puts you at a disadvantage, especially at earlier levels. Sure, you do level faster, but on a per-encounter basis you're
going to be more powerful if you're a non-human.

And in general, I'm fairly confident that a dwarven or high elf paladin will fare much better than a human better (racial bonuses
are somewhat offset by exp penalty I believe).

Brian
